title: AbuBhakar
author: AbuBhakar
content: It all started when I saw a tweet of casino about user winning jackpot prize on a slot game. I become interested to try my luck hoping that I can manage to win that same multiplier or close to it. At first I’m winning decent profit like 6$ for a 0.1$ bet in just a couple of spin then later on the slot game stop giving profit even after many spin. This scenario keeps happening to multiple times but still I can’t stop playing this slot game whenever I’m visiting the casino. I’m winning on other game but this specific game keeps draining my funds.The game is called Big Bamboo by push gaming. I keep coming back because of its cool animation and early payout. This attracts me to play more because it gives me false hope that I can win bigger amount on next spin.

comments.body: Ever since  I first played Crash game I never missed a week playing it, I have one week of a losing streak on this game but I keep on playing it because of the excitement I get from playing it I never expect to win I just place my bet and play manually hoping that I can hit a 100 times multiplier but until now I cannot get it but still love playing it.We have weaknesses in games in a casino but as long as you enjoy the game and you spend money that you can afford to lose, you can forget winning it will just come in a way you never expect it.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: The situation faced and shared by OP is really common among many gamblers who are fans of slot machine games. They are constantly losing on long term, but they can never stop playing, because it's a very entertaining hobby of theirs. I know that because I had close people to me who displayed this kind of behavior. When they lost, they felt upset and even blamed the machines, as the casino was rigged, however on the next week they were there again for another gambling session. And when they won, it was like they have never lost before, they count that as liquid profit...

It does work but there are times it could get brutal and it doesn't hit amounts that could get me back to ROI. That's my story for now but I may change strategy once I get to a rank that I am okay with.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Rocket/bustabit/crash style games did this to me. I have seen the rocket staying in the air for so long and giving out x100 profits seeing that drove me crazy so I kept playing. Somehow the moment I participated in the next round, that damn rocket crashed in 10 seconds.  Of course I don't blame the casino for that. It is just my bad luck. Sometimes you jump off the rocket and it keeps flying and that is also frustrating. This is what makes these games addicting in the end. In the end it is not much different than playing a simple dice game but the entertainment you get is pretty damn addicting.
